Reviews.Title: “No More Than A 2 Star (if that)”
Reviews.Author: marinman1
Reviews.Content: First off, this property IS NOT in Polanco (check a map) It is nearby in a rather dismal area (across from the run down FiestaAmerica Hotel). It is nothing more than a dolled up bad Holiday Inn. The lobby is tacky with a small coffee bar (no gift shop or anything that exclusive) and the furniture is something out of a Motel 6. The "suite" I upgraded to is a joke. You walk in the door to a dark, windowless room with a desk and chair and then walk into the actual room with the bed and they call this a 1 bedroom suite!! Once again, the furniture is very basic, no shelves or drawers for clothing (only a small closet). The lighting is out of a bad Chinese restaurant, extremely bright and no dimmers on anything. There are 3 channels in English on the television and of course no extra blankets or pillows in the closet (I guess they couldn't fit them in) The bathroom is small and only has a shower with a plastic door and wall around it. There was no wine openers or bottle openers and when I asked for one they brought up another bottle of water (no, the staff is not bi lingual either). The "bar/restaurant" on the roof is just a large room sans bar (a few bottles on a bus tray was the bar) brightly lit with what is the best thing about this joint, the view. I booked this hotel for a birthday celebration and upgraded for a suite in the Polanco and got a two bit tacky room in a less than desirable area paying more than I normally do in a very decent hotel in a better part of town. Do yourself and favor and DON'T STAY IN THIS PLACE.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Relatively Inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: H A
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to be relatively close to family for a wedding (other hotels that were closer had terrible reviews). Hotel rooms are very small but sparkling clean; bathroom is large. Bed is insanely comfortable. Staff is very helpful. Drivers waiting are much appreciated and prices are not unreasonable (220 pesos--$20 to airport for two people). Would stay here again for the good location (close to Chapultepec Park) and ease of being relatively central in the city. Also like the free wifi, and nice bath products, including conditioner.

Reviews.Title: “new hotel, outstanding room mixed location”
Reviews.Author: Antoines
Reviews.Content: I was one night i wish i had stay for more as the bed in the room is perfect , trust me one of the best bed available in the place. wolfgan puck coffe maker ,sad just once capsule available for me. bath and body works spa toiletries soap, shampoo, body gel. soft egyptiam cotton 300 T bed linen and duvet that was a proper bed for real rest i want like that in my room the mattres is high quality no doubt. location is few blocks away reforma avenue, chapultepec metro station nearby but you need a map when the first time i had to ask a gentle police man directions to the hotel. one block from ugly and dated fiesta americana grand chapultepec. my rate was with no breakfast and that was good as the property has no resto just a little coffe shop with one barista who makes coffe, sandwiches, is in charge of the desk and the bread available there was no tasty i had croissaint but not good, if u¡you want a nice bakery try EL GLOBE several spots over mexico city even in the airport, the best croisaints outside europe i had ever had YUMMI, in the night the street is kinda lonely, so if you need to go out i advice to take a taxi. but tdonto stop coming mexico city is a wonderful city, hotel area is always with police patrol all round the day and night i mean after dark the area is lonely and i prefer strets full of people day and night like historic centre holiday inn zocalo hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Average. Reasonable value for money if on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: Aussiewanderer7
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel but decent value for money. Rooms tiny but okay and clean. Location average. Breakfast terrible - as most not 5 star hotels in Mex City - stale bread and not much else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and super friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheGreekhere
Reviews.Content: Love the free Wifi! Great service and very clean. 82 year old father loved the bathroom and Herman Miller office chair. Really nice to have an office with separate door and sofa in room. They let us check in 5 hours early. We just wanted to drop of the bags. My father thought it was family run, that is how great the service was. We had stayed at the Sheraton Maria Isabella, but this hotel is a lot better for seniors. It is across the street from the Park and has taxis in the front. What stood out was the design and service. I have been to Mexico City over 20 times and will try to stay there from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Best of hotels in Mexico City I tried so far”
Reviews.Author: Jmacq92
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in two other hotels in Mexico City and the Wyndham is by far the best quality/price ratio. Especially when you factor in the fact that you have to pay for WiFi and breakfast in most Polanco hotels on top of the room fee. Not at the Wyndham.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with affordable rates”
Reviews.Author: Capodicapi2
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is quite small; and I have to say that the location is not bad. It's located just 2 blocks from Chapultepec Park; and about 5 blocks from "Avenida Masarik" where you will find all kind of restaurants and bars. What I didn't enjoy that much is that the gym is quite basic with only cardio equipment; but the most negative thing about the hotel is that the rooms don't have a fridge!!! So if you want to buy something to drink, you'd better drink it fast. The service was extraordinary with everyone extremely willing to help you in every possible way. I would recommend this hotel is you're traveling for tourism; and if you get a low rate.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in everyway”
Reviews.Author: LRS619
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I stayed 10 days on business - with a weekend of sightseeing. We found everything about this hotel, especially the staff, delightful. The rooms were comfortable with A/C and wireless working well. We were able to walk home from business meetings from Paseo Reforma and too the wonderful restaurants along Maseryk Ave and surrounds. We felt the neighborhood was safe and close to the Museum of Archeology. The best part was the extremely gracious and helpful staff. Need an iron...you'll get one in 2 minutes. Want a recommendation for the best Mole in town...you got it. We also got a great rate of 80 USD through the Better World Club.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class for a Reasonable Price!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_JunkieXII
Reviews.Content: Okay, you have to know this hotel left a lasting impression, when I'm writing about my stay there over 6 months later. Seriously, I'm ashamed I hadn't done this sooner, as I really value the reviews others post for me to read. A friend, and I booked our stay at the Wyndham Garden Hotel Mexico City Polanco for this past New Year's Eve. Every part of it was really delightful, from the room to the hospitality of the hotel staff. The rooms were very comfortable, and well maintained. The location made accessing the various areas of Mexico City very convenient. But, the hotel staff really made it top class for me. I wish I had the names of those we interacted with, but the two staff members that worked the overnight on New Year's Eve were by far the most superior, not just New Year's Eve, but during our entire stay. I believe the female staff member was a manager, and then there was a gentleman that worked that same evening with her. They were so quick to accommodate our every need, and made our stay easy, and enjoyable. The next time I'm in Mexico City, I will be staying at the Wyndham Garden again. Thank you for an enjoyable, and memorable stay. Top Class!

Reviews.Title: “Very good - Above average for Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: MacRobertson
Reviews.Content: By mistake, I booked a one-bed room. The very kind recepcionist upgraded us to a room with 2 beds with at no extra charge, which was great! This hotel is the cheapest in its category and provides almost the same features as others hotels would. Service is definitely its greatest asset. Location is also quite convenient. However, I've got 3 complains: 1. beds are very soft so sleeping is difficult, 2. breakfast is very poor, and 3. lighting throughout the hotel and the rooms is a cold light, blue colored, not very bright (those awful energy-saver bulbs), and it can turn your mood down very quickly. A plus: free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, confortable and safe. Stay away from their taxi !”
Reviews.Author: HomosapiensCanada
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great "no extra" place. There is no pool, no big gym, no big restaurant, but the most important is there, a great clean room with a king size bed, a great bathroom with a shower large enough for two and with a lot of water pressure. Free small bottles of water, great kit of soaps, and great service. I have just paid 26,50 US$ / night (10 nights for a total of 265 US$) for a suite (a little office with a sofa bed and a bedroom) with Orbitz. Incredible I know !!!! BUT please note that at the rack rate this hotel doesn't worth it an it is possible to find better places for less in Mexico city. Unfortunately they try to sell you the services of there own taxis at the door. The personnel is always waiting outside to be sure you cannot catch another one, Be carefull, They will charge you an eye and a leg, check always the fare in advance. They charge 3 times the price of a radiotaxi catched on the street. Free WiFi quite slow.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome hotel”
Reviews.Author: maggie30
Reviews.Content: The hotel is either new or remodeled. I had the room for 60 dollars a night (negociated on priceline) then I upgraded there for less then 20 bucks a night.Everythiing is tastefully decorated and modern. I had a comfortable king size bed, nice size bathroom,2 flat screen tvs, and a small living room. .Oh and free wifi! The restaurant is limited, but for breakfast it was convinent. The staff is very friendly and will go out of their way to keep you content! They have a travel agency that books tours, I wouldnt recommened the city on (use the panflet that they have at the entrance for the hop on hop off bus instead) The Pyramid tour is well worth it! They also have the hotel taxi but they are a bit pricey. Also if you are going to use them, first ask the hotel about how much it would cost, then when u get in to the taxi ask again. To get to the center you will need to either take the taxi, or the bus. This is the onlly one thing I didnt like about the hotel was the location. One more thing, write this down El Fogonsito- this is a restaurant arround the corner that is to die for and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Staff!”
Reviews.Author: zoenri
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, super comfortable and quiet. We had to upgrade to a suite because we were three and we had made reservations via an online source. The transaction was painless and actually a good deal compared to their advertised prices for a suite. The room was clean and comfortable, not big but not small either. After traveling throughout Guanajuato and Oaxaca, this was definitely a treat, since we were able to have a restful night in the plush king size bed. My boyfriend slept on the sleeper sofa and felt it was slightly more comfortable than other hotels we had stayed. Hotel staff were soooo nice and accommodating. The two gentleman who worked either day time or afternoon/evening shifts were excellent! The hotel car was convenient for a quick Polanco drive to a restaurant. Very nice guy too. He even gave us his cell number to call him for a pick up from the restaurant. Unfortunately, the restaurant could not call personal cell numbers (???). Location was just okay. I like taking the Metro ($3 pesos per person), but the walk was a bit far and not the best at night. There are some places to eat across the street, but we really didn't venture out in the area, except for Chapultepec Park. Its walking distance where you'll find museums and the Turibus stop. Lastly, make sure you tell the cab driver the hotel is located in Colonia Nueva Anzures. Otherwise, they'll have a hard time finding it, costing you much pesos. Also, same street as Fiesta Americana POLANCO, practically across the street. Tell driver its on Leon Tolstoi, between Liebnitz and Dante streets near the Torre Mayor (supposed to be the tallest building in Latin America).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-NOT CLEAN!”
Reviews.Author: MexicanTourist_9
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham was located right near the Chapultapec Park. That was the only good thing about the hotel. I was very dissapointed about the service and the cleanliness of the hotel. There was a card on the night stand that gave you the option to have your sheets then put the card on the pillow, but if you wanted to "save the earth" then you could put the card on your nightstand and they wouldn't wash you sheets. We put the card on our pillow everyday and our sheets were only changed 2X in 10 nights! The sheets had stains on them so you could always tell when they had been changed or not. Sometimes the housekeeper would replace the shampoo, soap, etc.. and sometimes she wouldn't. Same with the coffee, towels, and even the toilet paper! There is so much noise from the streets because it was a major route for Micro busses and general traffic. Even on the 7th floor we couldn't sleep past 6 am! I will never stay here again! They also have to dressers and a very small closet. I do not recommend anyone to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: alongest555
Reviews.Content: It was Awesome!!! Was modern, nice, and well-kept. The staff was very accomadating. I would definately recommend the hotel to anyone.
